data.name: Sample input
data.description: Name of the biological material used for the extraction.

data.name: Extraction Method
data.description: The protocol used to extract the metabolites from the biological material.

data.name: Post extraction
data.description: Only applies to materials used for Mass Spectrometry. Extract concentration, Samples enrichment and resuspension processes e.g Dried under nitrogen, resuspended in H2O or pyridine, SPE column.

data.name: Derivatization
data.description: Only applies to materials used for Mass Spectrometry. Derivatization methods e.g. OMS, TMS

data.name: Extract Name
data.description: User-defined names for each portion of extracted material.

data.name: protocol
data.description: Chromatography protocol used to separate the metabolites.

data.name: Input extract
data.description: Extract that is used for the chromatography.

data.name: Chromatography Instrument
data.description: Chromatography Instrument, manufacturer and model

data.name: Column model
data.description: Model or make of the of Column used

data.name: Column type
data.description: Type of Chromatography used.

data.name: Labeled Extract Name
data.description: Identifier for the labeled extract.

data.name: Output Name
data.description: Output of the chromatography.

data.name: Label
data.description: Indicates a chemical or biological marker, such as a radioactive isotope or a fluorescent dye which is bound to a material in order to make it detectable by some assay technology.

data.name: protocol
data.description: Chromatography protocol used to separate the metabolites.

data.name: Input extract
data.description: Extract that is used for the chromatography.

data.name: Chromatography Instrument
data.description: Chromatography Instrument, manufacturer and model

data.name: Column model
data.description: Model or make of the of Column used

data.name: Column type
data.description: Type of Chromatography used.

data.name: Labeled Extract Name
data.description: Identifier for the labeled extract.

data.name: Output Name
data.description: Output of the chromatography.

data.name: Label
data.description: Indicates a chemical or biological marker, such as a radioactive isotope or a fluorescent dye which is bound to a material in order to make it detectable by some assay technology.

data.name: Mobile phase
data.description: Specify the liquid or gas used to transport the analytes through the chromatography column during a chromatographic separation. In liquid chromatography (LC), this typically includes a solvent or a mixture of solvents, while in gas chromatography (GC), it involves an inert carrier gas. Individual solvents should separated by a “/”, e.g. “10% H2O / 90% ACN”

data.name: Gradient profile setting
data.description: Specify the profile of the ratio of solvents in the mobile phase used over the course of a chromatographic separation. Use notation whereby relative proportions of the eluents at a specific time point are separated by “/”, e.g. “10/90 at 1 min”. Different time points are separated by a comma. Include re-equilibration times. Example: '0/100 at 0 min, 100/0 at 6 min, 0/100 at 7 min, 0/100 at 10 min'

data.name: Column temperature
data.description: Specify the temperature in degrees Celsius (°C) at which the chromatography column was maintained during the separation process.

data.name: Flow rate
data.description: Specify the rate at which the mobile phase moves through the chromatography column during the separation process.
